title: 1971–72 Ekstraklasa
text:
The 1971–72 I liga was the 46th season of the <a href="List%20of%20Polish%20football%20champions">Polish Football Championship</a> and the 38th season of the <a href="Ekstraklasa">I liga</a>, <a href="Polish%20football%20league%20system">the top Polish professional league</a> for <a href="association%20football">association football</a> clubs, since its establishment in <a href="1927%20Ekstraklasa">1927</a>. The league was operated by the <a href="Polish%20Football%20Association">Polish Football Association</a> (PZPN).
The defending champions were <a href="G%C3%B3rnik%20Zabrze">Górnik Zabrze</a>, who won their 10th Polish title.
Competition modus.
The season started on 7 August 1971 and concluded on 28 June 1972 (autumn-spring league). The season was played as a <a href="round-robin%20tournament">round-robin tournament</a>. The team at the top of the standings won the league title. A total of 14 teams participated, 12 of which competed in the league during the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20Ekstraklasa">1970–71 season</a>, while the remaining two were promoted from the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20II%20liga">1970–71 II liga</a>. Each team played a total of 26 matches, half at home and half away, two games against each other team. Teams received two points for a win and one point for a draw.
